alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks; Steele; Traill; Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 10 at 6:36PM CST until March 10 at 7:15PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Marshall County in northwestern Minnesota... Northwestern Norman County in northwestern Minnesota... Western Polk County in northwestern Minnesota... Eastern Grand Forks County in northeastern North Dakota... Traill County in southeastern North Dakota... Southeastern Walsh County in northeastern North Dakota... Eastern Steele County in southeastern North Dakota... * Until 715 PM CST. * At 635 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Oslo to 7 miles northeast of Emerado to near Golden Lake to near Sibley, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 93 and 161. This snow squall will be near... Oslo and Manvel around 640 PM CST. Alvarado, Grand Forks and Merrifield around 645 PM CST. East Grand Forks, March and Roseville around 650 PM CST. Mayville, Portland and Mallory around 655 PM CST. Warren and Davidson around 700 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Grand Forks Airport and American Crystal Sugar. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
